text: bow carrier jeaious lawar has arrived
rain and fog delayed her departure by
four days the overdue load is 55,000
tons of wood pellets vital fuel for the
mammoth Drax Power Station the UK's
largest power plant each day this plant
generates almost seven percent of the
UK's electricity needs down on the key
side crane operator Gary Carpenter is in
charge of the unload gary is reliant on
an oversized vacuum cleaner called a
continuous chiffon loader or CSU for
short the CSU is a massive 500 tons
sucking machine it's tube reaches down
into the hold of the ship and like a
giant corkscrew it spins around drinking
up the pellets to meet his deadline Gary
needs to suck up thirteen hundred and
fifty tons of pellets an hour
they go straight onto a conveyor belt
cover to protect them from the British
climate there are I think about 7
million pound piece of kits ain't got b3
on the ball what you're doing
the pellets will need to write a train
to the power station you want to come
this way which is another 35 miles away
Gary Johnson is in charge of loading
point five mile an hour for the shave
now it takes just over half an hour to
load enough pellets to fuel the tracks
tower for four hours the process is
automated to increase efficiency the
train doesn't actually stop it just
travels slowly enough so that each wagon
is filled by the time it has passed
through the loading bay Gary is there to
watch over the process ready to offer a
human hand if machine fails my job is to
make sure that the doors open if the
doors don't open how to stop the train
and when it's gone that way up to make
sure the doors are short so it doesn't
get wet all 24 wagons on the 1600 foot
long train are now loaded and just 40
minutes later the pellets have reached
Drax Power Station
